extracted_rules.title: Permissible driveway paving materials and standards compliance

Qualifiers.scope: Driveway surface materials on private property
Qualifiers.applicability: All driveways serving properties subject to city driveway standards

Variables.name: material_type
allowed_values: Hollywood strips (two paved strips with grass between)

Constants.name: standards_reference
Constants.notes: Materials shall meet Public Works standards. Work in ROW must comply with city standards (see RULE-ROW-PERMIT).

mandatory: Driveway surfaces may be either permeable or impermeable paving.
All driveway surface materials shall meet Public Works standards.

Exceptions: Use of gravel or similar loose materials is allowed generally, except within 10 ft of the public right-of-way per RULE-MAT-LOOSE-ROW.

related_rules.relationship: General allowance of gravel is constrained by proximity restriction near public right-of-way.
Materials and construction within the public ROW must comply with city standards and permit requirements.
Material permeability affects compliance with front yard impermeable coverage limit.

Ambiguities: ‘Public Works standards’ and ‘city standards’ are referenced without a specific document version or section.

extracted_rules.title: Prohibition of loose materials near the public right-of-way

Qualifiers.scope: Driveway surface segment adjacent to public right-of-way
Qualifiers.applicability: All driveway surfaces located within 10 ft of the public right-of-way (lot line)
Qualifiers.exclusions: Segments beyond 10 ft from the public right-of-way are not subject to this prohibition

mandatory: Driveway surface within 10 ft of the public right-of-way may not be of a loose material (e.g., gravel).
No gravel or similar loose materials within 10 ft of the public right-of-way (lot line).

overrides.relationship: Overrides general allowance of gravel for the portion of driveway within 10 ft of the public ROW.

related_rules.relationship: Adjacent to or within ROW work triggers permit and city standards compliance.

Ambiguities: ‘Similar loose materials’ is not exhaustively defined.
‘Public right-of-way’ measurement reference is indicated as ‘lot line’ in the figure, but the exact datum (back of sidewalk, curb face, property line) should be confirmed.

extracted_rules.title: Minimum driveway widths (surface and clearance)

Constants.name: driveway_surface_width_min_value
Constants.notes: Labeled ‘8' min. width for driveway surface (typ. all).

Constants.name: driveway_clearance_width_min_value
Constants.notes: Labeled ‘10' min. width for driveway clearance (typ. all).

mandatory: Minimum driveway surface width is 8 ft.
Minimum driveway clearance width is 10 ft.

related_rules.relationship: Clearance and surface width contribute to maneuverability to required parking spaces.

Ambiguities: ‘Driveway clearance’ is not defined; unclear if it refers to unobstructed width between vertical elements, landscape edges, or includes flares.

extracted_rules.title: Curb cut spacing and number

Qualifiers.scope: Curb cuts associated with driveways along street frontages
Qualifiers.applicability: All properties proposing one or more curb cuts

encouraged: No more than one curb cut per single frontage.
Minimum of 50 ft between curb cut and intersection curb face.

related_rules.relationship: Creation or modification of curb cuts involves work in the public ROW requiring permit and compliance with city standards.
Shared driveway requirement for second dwelling units supports the encouraged limit of one curb cut per frontage.

Ambiguities: ‘Single frontage’ is not defined; corner lots may have multiple frontages.
‘Intersection curb face’ as a measurement datum is not defined; need method of measurement (along curb line, radial, etc.).

extracted_rules.title: Front yard impermeable coverage limit

Qualifiers.scope: Required front yard area on a lot
Qualifiers.applicability: All lots with a required front yard as defined by zoning
Qualifiers.exclusions: Permeable surfaces are not counted as impermeable

Constants.name: max_impermeable_coverage_value
Constants.notes: No more than 40% of required front yard may be impermeable.

mandatory: Total impermeable coverage within the required front yard must not exceed 40% of the required front yard area.

depends_on.relationship: Depends on zoning definitions to determine the boundaries and area of the ‘required front yard’.

related_rules.relationship: Choice of permeable vs. impermeable driveway materials affects compliance with the 40% limit.

Ambiguities: ‘Required front yard’ is not defined here; must reference zoning code for the yard depth and lot-specific dimensions.
Accounting rules for partially permeable systems (e.g., pavers with grass joints) are not specified.

extracted_rules.title: Shared driveway requirement for second dwelling units

Qualifiers.scope: Driveway access for lots with a main dwelling and a second dwelling unit
Qualifiers.applicability: Properties proposing or containing a second dwelling unit (ADU or similar)

mandatory: Second dwelling units must share a common driveway with the main dwelling.
conditional_logic: If a second dwelling unit is present or proposed, then only a shared/common driveway is permitted for both dwellings.

related_rules.relationship: Sharing a driveway typically limits the number of curb cuts, aligning with the encouraged standard of one curb cut per frontage.

Ambiguities: ‘Second dwelling units’ is not defined (e.g., whether it includes all ADUs, JADUs); cross-reference with definitions section needed.
Treatment of corner lots with multiple frontages is not specified.

extracted_rules.title: Maneuverability to required parking spaces

Qualifiers.scope: Vehicle maneuvering along driveway paths to required parking spaces
Qualifiers.applicability: Projects where vehicles must make turns en route to required parking spaces
Qualifiers.exclusions: Straight approaches without turns are implicitly unaffected

Constants.name: approval_requirement
Constants.value: Turns enroute to required parking spaces must be deemed maneuverable by the Transportation Division.

mandatory: Where the path to required parking spaces includes turns, the Transportation Division must determine that the turns are maneuverable.
conditional_logic: IF path_to_required_parking has_turns == true THEN Transportation Division maneuverability approval is required.

related_rules.relationship: Minimum driveway surface and clearance widths contribute to maneuverability feasibility.

Ambiguities: ‘Maneuverable’ is not quantified; no turning radius or aisle width criteria provided.
‘Required parking spaces’ reference depends on separate parking standards not included here.

extracted_rules.title: Permit and standards for work within the public right-of-way

Qualifiers.scope: Construction or alteration within the public right-of-way related to driveways (e.g., curb cuts, aprons, sidewalk transitions)
Qualifiers.applicability: Any work performed within the public right-of-way
Qualifiers.exclusions: Work entirely on private property outside of the public right-of-way

Constants.name: permit_requirement_trigger
Constants.value: work done within the public right-of-way

mandatory: A street-work permit is required for any work done within the public right-of-way.
Work done within the public right-of-way must comply with city standards.
conditional_logic: IF work_location == ‘within public right-of-way’ THEN require ‘street-work permit’ AND enforce compliance with ‘city standards’.

related_rules.relationship: Curb cut construction/modification is within the ROW and triggers this permit and standards compliance.
Materials used in the ROW must meet city standards; may be more specific than general Public Works standards stated for private property.
Proximity and material restrictions near ROW align with compliance requirements for ROW work.

Ambiguities: Issuing department and exact permit process for ‘street-work permit’ are not specified.
‘City standards’ are not cited by document number or section.
